radiographic_examinations.findings: A hypodense lesion in the pancreatic head on arterial phase imaging, not seen on portal venous phase imaging.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The lesion was difficult to identify on initial review due to its proximity to the duodenum.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Hypointense lesion on T1-weighted imaging, hyperintense on T2-weighted imaging, and hyperintense on diffusion-weighted imaging, but no lesion seen on images obtained after contrast administration.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant changes described over time.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Revealed a hypoechoic, homogeneous, well-defined, nearly spherical lesion (1.6 cm) located in the head of the pancreas.
